metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4148 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel's block_invalidatepage in fs/buffer.c in the filesystem. A missing sanity check may allow a local attacker with user privilege to cause a denial of service (DOS) problem.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-aws - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1001-azure - 5.15.0-1001.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1001-gcp - 5.15.0-1001.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gke - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1002-raspi - 5.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-5.15.0-1002-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer links in second lore email likely introduced in eb6ecbed0aa2 (v5.14) no fix upstream as of 2022.02.11
